info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 19 at 3:53AM AKST until November 20 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Locally higher amounts possible along the Ahklun Mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.
* WHERE...Inland Bristol Bay and Northern Bristol Bay Coast.
* WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 PM AKST Thursday.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Visibility could be reduced significantly in heavy snow or in areas of blowing snow.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will remain near freezing this evening through Thursday evening. Precipitation rates will be most intense overnight tonight through Thursday morning where most snow accumulation will take place. The airmass is not overly warm or cold. If warmer air is able to mix in more and result in more of a rain/snow mix, snow totals would be lower. Conversely, if there is more cold air in the column, there is potential to have greater snowfall totals.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM AKST THURSDAY

area.areaDesc: Northern Bristol Bay Coast; Inland Bristol Bay
